title: I Fell Into The New Minecraft Lush Cave! - Minecraft Hardcore #22

comments.comment: Pewdiepie literally has one of the sickest hardcore bases ever, I'm amazed.
It's a miracle, this series might actually continue for a bit :)
Its hard to believe he started out on a simple hill, with a little wood house, and a pet bee

Felix is a true minecrafter rn. Does he need diamonds? No. Does he still mine them? Yes, bc they're diamonds.
A Minecraft Veteran he is
"Everyone loves fun here" is probably the most menacing quote of the whole series
The shaders definitely make the lush caves look even cooler.
His world is getting better everyday. The upgrade in his nether lobby is sure horrifying to build especially in hardcore. Props to Pewds for his dedication.
I love how Felix do exploring, he'll be like kids and wowing everything. That's adorable

pewds, use bonemeal on the tiny trees and theyll grow into big trees with flowers in them. Also, to place the glow berries you have to place it under a block, sadly leaves dont allow you to place them under it cause its not considered a block, same with lanterns (they cant be placed attached to leaf blocks). Also, when you place the glowberries theyll be a small vine and eventually grow out and make glow berries. To harvest the glowberries faster, you can bone meal the vine and thats how you can collect glowberries to plant more of them, otherwise when you break a vine there is not way to collect it (it disappears). Love you pewds
I hope this series never ends
The editor did a 11/10 job of putting Terraria's Junngle Theme in the new cave biome
If anyone else was wondering what mob that is in the thumbnail, it's a mob concept called a Florat that lives in lush caves, floating around with the puffy scruff on its neck. I love it!
moss is such a good block for building honsetly, it gives alot of texture and color variation so this has to be one of my favorite updates
I'm really hoping this series goes on for a while and doesn't end as abruptly as Sven
The terraria theme playing in the background actually goes really well with the lush cave lol
I love the terraria music in the lush caves
